.class public auto ansi sealed DataGridItemEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub DataGridItemEventHandler(sender As Object, e As DataGridItemEventArgs)
public delegate void DataGridItemEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, DataGridItemEventArgs ^ e);
type DataGridItemEventHandler = delegate of obj * DataGridItemEventArgs -> unit

param.name: e
param.span: Objeto que contiene los datos del evento.

span.span: A that contains the event data.

summary.span: Representa el método que controla los eventos y de un control .

span.span: Represents the method that handles the and events of a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks El evento se produce cuando un elemento en el se crea el control.The event is raised when an item in the control is created. El evento se produce cuando un elemento en el control se enlaza a un origen de datos.The event is raised when an item in the control is bound to a data source. Cuando se crea un delegado , se identifica el método que controlará el evento.When you create a delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. Para asociar el evento al controlador, se debe agregar una instancia del delegado al evento.To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. Siempre que se produce el evento, se llama a su controlador, a menos que se quite el delegado.The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. Para obtener más información sobre los delegados de controlador de eventos, consulte [controlar y provocar eventos](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).For more information about event handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples El código siguiente muestra cómo especificar y codificar un controlador para el eventos para mostrar el orden en que se crean elementos en el control.The following code example demonstrates how to specify and code a handler for the event to display the order in which items are created in the control. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic DataGridItemEventArgs Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridItemEventArgs Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic DataGridItemEventArgs Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Classic DataGridItemEventArgs Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-csharp[DataGridItemDataBound#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridItemDataBound/CS/datagriditemdataboundcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataGridItemDataBound#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridItemDataBound/VB/datagriditemdataboundvb.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-csharp[DataGridItemDataBound2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridItemDataBound2/CS/datagriditemdatabound2cs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[DataGridItemDataBound2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/DataGridItemDataBound2/VB/datagriditemdatabound2vb.aspx#1)]
